POR.content: metaphysics associates sight w/ knowledge (eg. Aristotle)

HERP.content: Heidegger claims that all metaphysicians (strangers to the originarity of Heraclitus’ logos) committed an anachronic anthroplogization abusively reappropriating H’s word (parole)
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger claims that all metaphysicians (strangers to the originarity of Heraclitus’ logos) committed an anachronic anthroplogization abusively reappropriating H’s word (parole)

POOF.content: Heidegger: in accomplishment of metaphysics, metaphysics becomes ‘psychology,’ psychology & anthropology are last word of metaphysics—psychology & technics go hand in hand
POOF.linkedContent: Heidegger: in accomplishment of metaphysics, metaphysics becomes ‘psychology,’ psychology & anthropology are last word of metaphysics—psychology & technics go hand in hand

EM.content: Heidegger: “every humanism remains metaphysical” > metaphysics, the other name of ontotheology [see p. 118 (140n)]

thinking of end of man prescribed in metaphysics, in thinking truth of man > difficulty today to think an end of man not organized by dialectics of truth & negativity, an end of man that’s not a teleology in first person plural
EM.linkedContent: thinking of end of man prescribed in metaphysics, in thinking truth of man > difficulty today to think an end of man not organized by dialectics of truth & negativity, an end of man that’s not a teleology in first person plural

EM.content: nous: assures proximity to itself of central being for which circular reappropriation is produced; nous: unity of absolute knowledge and anthropology, God & man, of onto-theo-teleology and humanism
EM.linkedContent: nous: assures proximity to itself of central being for which circular reappropriation is produced; nous: unity of absolute knowledge and anthropology, God & man, of onto-theo-teleology and humanism

EM.content: “l’être” et la langue est le nom de ce qui assure ce passage par le nous entre la métaphysique et l’humanisme
EM.linkedContent: “l’être” et la langue est le nom de ce qui assure ce passage par le nous entre la métaphysique et l’humanisme

EM.content: for Heidegger, what is threatened in extension of metaphysics & technology is the essence of man, devastation of languages threat to essence of humanity
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, what is threatened in extension of metaphysics & technology is the essence of man, devastation of languages threat to essence of humanity

EM.content: Nietzsche’s übermensch “burns his text and erases the traces of his steps,” a laughter bursting beyond metaphysics
EM.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s übermensch “burns his text and erases the traces of his steps,” a laughter bursting beyond metaphysics

VM.content: for Levinas, metaphysics is essence of discourse w/ God
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, metaphysics is essence of discourse w/ God

VM.content: metaphysics unable to escape its ancestry in light, always supposes phenomenology in its critique of phenomenology [re: Levinas]
VM.linkedContent: metaphysics unable to escape its ancestry in light, always supposes phenomenology in its critique of phenomenology [re: Levinas]

VM.content: Heidegger allows Hegel’s discourse to grow and speak (Hegel’s discourse as that of all metaphysics)
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger allows Hegel’s discourse to grow and speak (Hegel’s discourse as that of all metaphysics)

VM.content: for Heidegger, metaphysics thinks Being of existent but not the difference btwn Being and existent
VM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, metaphysics thinks Being of existent but not the difference btwn Being and existent

VM.content: Heidegger never meant transgression of metaphysics as new metaphysical thesis, always remarked on “strange simplicity” of thought of Being
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger never meant transgression of metaphysics as new metaphysical thesis, always remarked on “strange simplicity” of thought of Being

VP.content: why phenomenology belongs to metaphysics: exteriority of indication in relation to expression
VP.linkedContent: why phenomenology belongs to metaphysics: exteriority of indication in relation to expression

S.content: “is a metaphysics of race more or less serious than a naturalism or biologism of race?”
S.linkedContent: “is a metaphysics of race more or less serious than a naturalism or biologism of race?”

WM.content: classical motif, etymon of a primitive sense always determinable, interprets degradation as passage from physical to metaphysical > [valuing sensory image as “original figure,” against the concept, is its own conceptualization]
WM.linkedContent: classical motif, etymon of a primitive sense always determinable, interprets degradation as passage from physical to metaphysical > [valuing sensory image as “original figure,” against the concept, is its own conceptualization]

WM.content: in classical rhetoric, were metaphor to receive its name from metaphysics, it would be the catachresis: a “nontrue metaphor,” retracing metaphor through its philosophical ghost
WM.linkedContent: in classical rhetoric, were metaphor to receive its name from metaphysics, it would be the catachresis: a “nontrue metaphor,” retracing metaphor through its philosophical ghost

WM.content: Rousseau: metaphysics used to be an instinct, became a science when it ceased to be good
WM.linkedContent: Rousseau: metaphysics used to be an instinct, became a science when it ceased to be good

DS.content: never has anteriority of 1st (simple) over 2nd (double) been displaced by a metaphysical system, double de-presents, il le multiplie par suite, le double vient après le simple, the flesh & blood, l’image survient à la réalité > this is ontology
DS.linkedContent: never has anteriority of 1st (simple) over 2nd (double) been displaced by a metaphysical system, double de-presents, il le multiplie par suite, le double vient après le simple, the flesh & blood, l’image survient à la réalité > this is ontology

DS.content: one of most typical metaphysical reappropriations of writing: if mimesis mimics nothing then it is the act of unveiling itself, alētheia, a primordial union btwn alētheia and mimeisthai
DS.linkedContent: one of most typical metaphysical reappropriations of writing: if mimesis mimics nothing then it is the act of unveiling itself, alētheia, a primordial union btwn alētheia and mimeisthai

OS.content: metaphysical texts already have resources of their own criticism [re: circle of circles of time] (announces itself in the margin) [doubling of de-limitation]
OS.linkedContent: metaphysical texts already have resources of their own criticism [re: circle of circles of time] (announces itself in the margin) [doubling of de-limitation]

OS.content: must think play of submission & subtraction as formal rule to read history of metaphysics w/in opening of Heidegger’s breakthrough [re: categories such as desire, movement, time]
OS.linkedContent: must think play of submission & subtraction as formal rule to read history of metaphysics w/in opening of Heidegger’s breakthrough [re: categories such as desire, movement, time]

POS.content: metaphysics always attempts to uproot presence of meaning from differance
POS.linkedContent: metaphysics always attempts to uproot presence of meaning from differance

POS.content: metaphysical concept of history: meaning developing itself in straight, circular line
POS.linkedContent: metaphysical concept of history: meaning developing itself in straight, circular line

ATIA.content: Heidegger’s Fundamental Concepts… begins by describing philosophy, metaphysics, homesickness and melancholy as forms of nostalgia
ATIA.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Fundamental Concepts… begins by describing philosophy, metaphysics, homesickness and melancholy as forms of nostalgia

PS.content: Derrida suggests we wonder about link btwn concept of madness/concept of metaphysics by thinking how no [Heideggerian] “destruction” of history of metaphysics simply surpasses it
PS.linkedContent: Derrida suggests we wonder about link btwn concept of madness/concept of metaphysics by thinking how no [Heideggerian] “destruction” of history of metaphysics simply surpasses it

FS.content: darkness (self-concealment) /light (self-revelation) founding metaphor of Western philosophy as metaphysics: photology
FS.linkedContent: darkness (self-concealment) /light (self-revelation) founding metaphor of Western philosophy as metaphysics: photology

FS.content: “fall” of thought into philosophy, analogical displacement of Being which anchors (retient) and irremediably represses discourse in metaphysics, gets history under way (est entamée)
FS.linkedContent: “fall” of thought into philosophy, analogical displacement of Being which anchors (retient) and irremediably represses discourse in metaphysics, gets history under way (est entamée)

Gii.content: Heidegger: only when man speaks does he think, not the other way around, as metaphysics still believes
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger: only when man speaks does he think, not the other way around, as metaphysics still believes

RM.content: closure is not a circular limit (bordering homogenous field), but a more twisted (plus retorse) structure, another figure: “invaginated” (there is never “the” metaphysical”)
RM.linkedContent: closure is not a circular limit (bordering homogenous field), but a more twisted (plus retorse) structure, another figure: “invaginated” (there is never “the” metaphysical”)

RM.content: representation of a linear & circular closure surrounding a homogenous space is a self-representation of philosophy in its onto-encyclopedic logic
RM.linkedContent: representation of a linear & circular closure surrounding a homogenous space is a self-representation of philosophy in its onto-encyclopedic logic

RM.content: for Heidegger, Metasprache and Sputnik are the same, monstrous project of father, of metaphysics (mastery of form for form’s sake)
RM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Metasprache and Sputnik are the same, monstrous project of father, of metaphysics (mastery of form for form’s sake)

RM.content: metaphysics as series of guises, turns, modes, figures—vast structural process of epochē of Being withholding itself, holding itself in withdrawal > metaphysics as tropics, a singular metaphoric detour
RM.linkedContent: metaphysics as series of guises, turns, modes, figures—vast structural process of epochē of Being withholding itself, holding itself in withdrawal > metaphysics as tropics, a singular metaphoric detour

RM.content: even Plato’s eidos (visible/invisible) submits to metaphorico-metonymic displacement
RM.linkedContent: even Plato’s eidos (visible/invisible) submits to metaphorico-metonymic displacement

LI.content: Derrida cannot accept distinction btwn strategical decision & metaphysical presupposition: every strategy has a decision concerning metaphysics > the more confident, implicit, the more its order and calm reigns over methodological technicity
LI.linkedContent: Derrida cannot accept distinction btwn strategical decision & metaphysical presupposition: every strategy has a decision concerning metaphysics > the more confident, implicit, the more its order and calm reigns over methodological technicity

LI.content: speech act theory’s hierarchical axiology: set up value oppositions & subordinate these values to each other (normal/abnormal, parasite/nonparasite, fulfilled/void, serious/nonserious, literal/nonliteral, briefly: positive/negative, ideal/nonideal)
LI.linkedContent: speech act theory’s hierarchical axiology: set up value oppositions & subordinate these values to each other (normal/abnormal, parasite/nonparasite, fulfilled/void, serious/nonserious, literal/nonliteral, briefly: positive/negative, ideal/nonideal)

LI.content: —Plato, Rousseau, Descartes, Husserl: good before evil, simple before complex, positive before negative, pure before impure, essential before accidental, imitated before imitation (not one metaphysical gesture among others—the metaphysical exigency)
LI.linkedContent: —Plato, Rousseau, Descartes, Husserl: good before evil, simple before complex, positive before negative, pure before impure, essential before accidental, imitated before imitation (not one metaphysical gesture among others—the metaphysical exigency)

WOG.content: unity of history of metaphysics a domestic representation (economic reappropriation)
closure is not end of metaphysics, which doesn’t have a self-identity
WOG.linkedContent: closure is not end of metaphysics, which doesn’t have a self-identity

OG.content: history of metaphysics as history of truth, as the truth of truth, the debasement of writing, its repression outside (hors) of “full (pleine)” speech
OG.linkedContent: history of metaphysics as history of truth, as the truth of truth, the debasement of writing, its repression outside (hors) of “full (pleine)” speech

OG.content: totality of metaphysics creates hierarchy of signifier/signified [signified is higher, not exterior like signifier] (Christian creationism, infinitism, both appropriating Greek conceptualism)
OG.linkedContent: totality of metaphysics creates hierarchy of signifier/signified [signified is higher, not exterior like signifier] (Christian creationism, infinitism, both appropriating Greek conceptualism)

OG.content: metaphysics: exemplary system of defense against violence of writing > what is violence if something in it is equivalent to operation of the trace?
OG.linkedContent: metaphysics: exemplary system of defense against violence of writing > what is violence if something in it is equivalent to operation of the trace?

OG.content: in MOP, the ideal community speaks w/in earshot (à portée d’allocution) [Rousseau, Lévi-Strauss, Anarchists, Fourier, Libertarians]
OG.linkedContent: in MOP, the ideal community speaks w/in earshot (à portée d’allocution) [Rousseau, Lévi-Strauss, Anarchists, Fourier, Libertarians]

OG.content: impossibility of designating supplement escapes metaphysics by a hairsbreadth (par une pointe), “elle doit pour le reste puiser ses ressources dans la logique qu’elle déconstruit”
OG.linkedContent: impossibility of designating supplement escapes metaphysics by a hairsbreadth (par une pointe), “elle doit pour le reste puiser ses ressources dans la logique qu’elle déconstruit”

EU.content: metaphysics of morals deals w/ freedom not nature, rights & duty, to possess metaphysics is a duty > everyone has this metaphysics and thus this duty—a Faktum ——for Kant, metaphysics: a priori system of knowledge by simple concepts
EU.linkedContent: metaphysics of morals deals w/ freedom not nature, rights & duty, to possess metaphysics is a duty > everyone has this metaphysics and thus this duty—a Faktum ——for Kant, metaphysics: a priori system of knowledge by simple concepts
